summary: This document is an email chain from August 2021 discussing a potential spinoff interview from the Ghislaine Maxwell case. Prosecutors and agents coordinate to interview a new victim who reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001. The correspondence details scheduling and strategic considerations, including a preference to wait until after Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Black
persons.context: Individual accused by multiple victims of sexual assault at Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001, as discussed in the context of a potential new investigation.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault by Black
events.description: A victim reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named Black in a similar manner at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse.

events.title: Tentative Victim Interview Scheduled
events.description: A spinoff interview with a new victim was tentatively scheduled for May 18, 2021, to decide whether to open a new investigation.

events.title: Email Coordination on Spinoff Interview
events.description: Prosecutors and agents exchanged emails to coordinate the scheduling and strategy for interviewing a new victim from the Maxwell case, with a preference to wait until after Maxwell's trial.

keyFacts: A new victim reported being sexually assaulted by an individual named 'Black' at Jeffrey Epstein's Manhattan townhouse in 2001.
The victim's attorney contacted prosecutors, prompting discussions about a 'spinoff interview' from the Ghislaine Maxwell case to decide on opening a new investigation.

Prosecutors preferred to wait until after Maxwell's trial to conduct the interview, at which point they could also interview two other victims from the Epstein investigation who had previously discussed assaults by Black.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and federal agents regarding witness interviews and investigative strategy.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing effort to investigate allegations against associates of Epstein beyond the central figures already prosecuted.
